results.title: Poland
results.brief_description: Shows Warsaw and historic buildings. Warsaw has half of the total world population of Jews. Zinc is its prime export. In the country large estates, presided over by peasants are shown. School life includes lace making and woodcraft. In the main port of Gdynia, coal and lumber and the main exports.

results.title: Pola x [Widescreen] (E)
results.creator_credit: Leos Carax, Bruno Pesery, Arena Films and Polar Productions
results.brief_description: Leos Carax’s first feature since 1991’s “Les Amants du Pont Neuf” uses as its source material Herman Melville’s novel “Pierre or, the ambiguities”. In this modernisation of the novel, the comfortable world of privileged and idealistic novelist Pierre (Guillaume Depardieu) falls apart when he discovers that he has a sister called Isabelle, whose existence was kept secret from him by his possessive mother (Catherine Deneuve). This shock revelation causes Pierre to leave behind his charmed life and head to Paris where he embarks on a new novel and a journey to uncover the truth of the world. He soon discovers the dark side of human nature as he begins to slide into despair and embarks on a destructive relationship with his troubled sister. “Pola x” stumbles at times as it slips between youthful romanticism and utter nihilism. However it’s too easy to criticise Carax’s ambitious project or merely dismiss it as pretentious as some critics had. Ultimately “Pola x” maps a complex terrain, a grand, sweeping diatribe on contemporary society and, with that, it’s hard not to feel that Carax is as romantic and idealised as his tragic hero. Cast includes: Katerina Golubeva, Delphine Chuillot. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: Poky little puppy
results.creator_credit: Allan Frank Sandler, Little Golden Books Films, Sandler Institutional Films and Zagreb Film
results.brief_description: An animated cartoon about five puppies, one of whom calculates how to eat the desserts of the others. Designed to teach reading and number recognition. For primary grades. Based on the book of the same title by Janette Sebring Lowrey. Consultant Chuck Jones-Animator

results.title: Poise and movement
results.brief_description: The importance of balance and poise to prevent undue strain and unnecesary fatigue. Situations shows include nurses standing during a heavy ward round. Carrying a heavy loaded tray, lifting a heavy bag upstairs, giving bedside attentions and moving a double bed. Nurses from a London hospital demonstrates correct and incorrect ways of moving, first in uniform and then in swimsuits so that the actions of their limbs can be clearly seen.

results.title: Point of the stick
results.creator_credit: M Thompson, William Orr and Visnews Productions
results.brief_description: The overall objective is to illuminate the famed art of Sir Adrian Boult’s technique of conducting, in a fresh and personal way for each viewer. The film features Sir Adrian Boult conducting the London Philharmonic Orchestra with Moura Lympany (piano) and John Carol Case (baritone). Features the music of Beethoven, Handel, Mozart and Brahms.

results.title: Point of entry
results.creator_credit: Jack Rogers, Peter Johnson, Film Australia and Plant Quarantine Publicity Campaign
results.brief_description: In order to keep unwanted pests out of Australia, constant vigilance must be maintained at points of entry. This film deals mainly with the dangers to plants and crops if precautions are not exercised, and shows some of the methods taken to safeguard Australia’s plant life.

results.title: Point of danger: agriculture's first line of defence
results.creator_credit: Eric Thompson and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: An insight into the work of quarantine officers inspecting imports from abroad to detect plant diseases and insect pests which may bring ruin and destruction to Australian agriculture if introduced into this country.

results.title: Point of contact
results.brief_description: Shows the work that ordinary untrained volunteers do as opposed to trained professionals in helping the mentally ill. Shows the Personal Emergency Service in operaiton, and how specially trained volunteers man the telephone and answer calls for help. Dr Dax tells how volunteers help rehabilitate the mentally ill at the Kew Mental Hospital (Kew Cottages?) and their work is illustrated. Written and introduced by Anthony Evans.
